revised_title: Investigating the Resistance of Tubes to Collapse in Boilers
tldr: This article by William Fairbairn investigates the factors affecting the resistance of tubes in boilers to collapse under external pressure. The author examines the impact of tube length, diameter, and thickness on their strength and proposes modifications to boiler construction to improve safety at higher pressures. The findings provide valuable insights into boiler engineering and mechanical design for steam engines.
